name: Vegetable lasagna
description:
Vegetable sauce
Add olive oil and heat. Add chopped onion and cook until golden, then add garlic and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the vegetables in the mix (carrot and courgettes/aubergines here, but honestly use anything in the fridge...) and cook until the carrots are tender. Add mushrooms and cook for 5 mins, then add spinach and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, salt and pepper and cook for 5 mins. Then set aside.
Bechamel sauce
In a saucepan over low heat, melt the vegan butter. Then slowly add flour and keep mixing until a smooth paste forms. Then gradually add the warm vegan milk and keep whisking/mixing until the sauce is smooth and thick. Remove from heat and add vegan cheese.
Assembly
Spread a thin layer of the vegetable mixture to the bottom of the baking dish, layer lasagna sheets on top, spread 1/3 of the vegetable mixture, then spread 1/3 of the Bechamel sauce and sprinkle vegan cheese on top. Repeat this layering twice more for a total of 3 layers, finishing with a layer of Bechamel sauce and vegan cheese on top. Spray the bottom of some kitchen foil with cooking spray and cover the top of the pan/tray loosely.
Cooking
Bake at 180C, covered for 40 minutes and then uncovered for another 15-20. Let cool for 15-20 minutes before serving.
source
ingredients: 720ml warm non-dairy milk (I use Alpro Not Milk)
Can of green lentils (optional but nice)
1kg tomato sauce (I used cheap bolognese sauce)
